page.title: 03Yaxham Primary School
page.content: The school was built in the middle of the last century to serve the parish of Yaxham. As a Church of England Primary School it has proudly maintained its links with the local church. Today the school has a roll of around 50 pupils and 3 teaching staff. The old building with its "Gothic" windows hides the fact that inside there is a modern and well equipped school. The school field is used for a wide variety of activities. Parents and friends are closely involved with the life of the school; providing Fund Raising support and attending events such as Sports, Harvest and Christmas festivals, Plays, a Christmas Fayre,and Dances. At the age of eleven the majority of the children go to the local High School in East Dereham.
